intro: Hedeoma rubiacea, commonly known as redroot germander, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Labiatae, also known as the mint family, and is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in whorls along the stems. Its aromatic foliage and medicinal properties have made it historically valuable in traditional herbal medicine. Hedeoma rubiacea thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
